lesson_html:
• Hello! - A common way to greet someone.
  • How are you? - A friendly way to ask about someone's well-being.
  • Good morning! - Used in the morning until around noon.
  • Good afternoon! - Used from noon until about 5 PM.
  • Good evening! - Used after 5 PM until bedtime.

items.explanation_en: This question asks about someone's recent state or feelings.
This is a common question to inquire about the current time.

items.en: Do you have any plans for today?
items.explanation_en: This question asks if someone has activities scheduled for the day.

items.en: I hope you are doing well.
items.explanation_en: This expresses a wish for someone's good health or happiness.

items.en: What did you do last night?
items.explanation_en: This question inquires about someone's activities from the previous night.

items.en: Are you enjoying your time here?
items.explanation_en: This asks if someone is having a good experience in their current location.

items.en: Will you be at the party tomorrow?
items.explanation_en: This question asks about someone's attendance at a future event.

items.en: It's been a while since we last met.
items.target: Ha pasado un tiempo desde que nos vimos por última vez.
items.explanation_en: This acknowledges the time since the last meeting with someone.

items.en: What are you looking forward to this week?
items.explanation_en: This question asks about someone's anticipated events in the coming week.
This expresses a feeling of longing for someone's presence.
